Title: How can I prove $\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}...}}}}=2$
Content: How can I prove $$\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}...}}}}=2$$ I don't know which method can be used for this?
AcceptedAnswer:
We can define $x=\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}^{\sqrt{2}...}}}}$ as follows: Let $x_1 = \sqrt 2$ and $x_{n+1} = (\sqrt 2)^{x_{n}}$ We can show $x_n \lt 2\ \forall n$ by induction, since if $y \lt 2$, then $(\sqrt 2)^y \lt 2$. And $x_n$ is clearly monotonically increasing, so $x_n \to x$. But $$x_{n+1} = (\sqrt 2)^{x_{n}}$$
so taking limits, we get that $$x = (\sqrt 2)^{x}$$ Solving this, and using the fact that $x \le 2$ gives $x =2$.
